qas.question: Municipalities have how many major policy responsibilities?
What article grants the municipalities "the right to regulate on their own responsibility all the affairs of the local community within the limits set by law.
Under Article 28(2) local governments can justify what?
What is one way municipalities develop the economic infrastructure?
Who have three major policy responsibilities?
What is federal government responsible for administering?
Programs run by the state or federal government typically relate to what?
Local governments are limited by which article?
What guarantees state and federal governments their rights?

context: The <b4_0>municipalities<b4_0/> have two major policy responsibilities. First, they administer <b5_0>programs<b5_0/> authorized by the federal or state government. Such programs typically relate to youth, schools, public health, and <b6_0>social assistance<b6_0/>. Second, <a1_0><b7_0>Article 28<b7_0/>(2)<a1_0/> of the <b8_0>Basic Law<b8_0/> guarantees the municipalities "the right to regulate on their own responsibility all the affairs of the local community within the limits set by law." Under this broad statement of competence, <a0_0>local governments can justify<a0_0/> <a2_0>a wide range of activities<a2_0/>. For instance, many municipalities develop and expand the economic infrastructure of their communities through the <a3_0>development<a3_0/> of industrial trading estates.
